text: Vercel is a frontend cloud.

We are responsible for
building generative AI products
that help developers work faster
to improve developer experience

with our flagship product
being v0, which does just that.
v0 is a generative user interface

tool that allows you to take
simple text prompts and images
and generate code. And that code,

instead of that just
being something you copy
and paste out of a chat bot,

we actually render it
right in front of you.
Vercel chose Amazon Bedrock

because it met our our
security requirements,
our performance requirements,
and it allowed us to build on top

of our existing partnership
and experience with AWS,

and it just naturally
fit into the product.

We're very excited about
the breadth of model choice
that Amazon Bedrock provides.

It helps us experiment
and test out new ideas.
What struck us as unique
to Amazon Bedrock was its reliability
and its performance relative
to the others and its scalability.

Through our partnership
with AWS, we've been able

to scale v0's inference
on Bedrock very successfully
to meet the needs of our user base.
And that's been really helpful.

And knowing that Amazon has
that capacity ahead of time
and can grow with us

and scale with us has been
tremendous. Since launch,
we've seen 25 million UIs be generated,

which we're very proud of, and
Bedrock has been influential
throughout that entire process,
serving up all those requests.

It's just really exciting that
we're able to offer toolkits

and services that will
empower developers to create
that next generation of user experiences.
